bill_title: authorize the increase in the number of video lottery machines that may be placed in a licensed establishment under certain conditions.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the increase in the number of video lottery machines that may placed in a licensed establishment under certain conditions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 42-7A-44 be amended to read as follows: 42-7A-44. The placement of video lottery machines in licensed establishments shall be subject to the rules of the commission promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26. No more than ten fifteen video lottery machines may be placed in any licensed establishment. If more than ten video lottery machines are placed in a licensed establishment, the number of video lottery machines that run the South Dakota video lottery terminal communication protocol revision C & D may not exceed the number of machines that used the protocol in the establishment on July 1, 2014. The bar or lounge with an on-sale license issued pursuant to subdivision 35-4-2(12) or (16) shall be restricted to persons twenty-one years of age or older. The entrance to the area where video lottery machines are located shall display a sign that the premises are restricted to persons twenty-one years or older. Notwithstanding the restrictions in §§ 35-4-79 to 35-4-79.2, inclusive, persons under the age of twenty-one may only enter the premises where video lottery machines are located provided they are accompanied by a parent, guardian, or spouse of twenty-one years or older.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the increase in the number of video lottery machines that may placed in a licensed establishment under certain conditions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 42-7A-44 be amended to read as follows: 42-7A-44. The placement of video lottery machines in licensed establishments including the number of machines, not to exceed fifteen machines per establishment, shall be subject to the rules of the commission promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26. No more than ten video lottery machines may be placed in any licensed establishment. If more than ten video lottery machines are placed in a licensed establishment, the number of video lottery machines that run the South Dakota video lottery terminal communication protocol revision C & D may not exceed the number of machines that used the protocol in the establishment on July 1, 2014. The bar or lounge with an on-sale license issued pursuant to subdivision 35-4-2(12) or (16) shall be restricted to persons twenty-one years of age or older. The entrance to the area where video lottery machines are located shall display a sign that the premises are restricted to persons twenty-one years or older. Notwithstanding the restrictions in §§ 35-4-79 to 35-4-79.2, inclusive, persons under the age of twenty-one may only enter the premises where video lottery machines are located provided they are accompanied by a parent, guardian, or spouse of twenty-one years or older.

The bar or lounge with an on-sale license issued pursuant to subdivision 35-4-2(12) or (16) shall be restricted to persons twenty-one years of age or older. The entrance to the area where video lottery machines are located shall display a sign that the premises are restricted to persons twenty-one years or older. Notwithstanding the restrictions in §§ 35-4-79 to 35-4-79.2, inclusive, persons under the age of twenty-one may only enter the premises where video lottery machines are located provided they are accompanied by a parent, guardian, or spouse of twenty-one years or older.
